primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, who is currently hidden/absent in a world of darkness and suffering, is called upon to manifest His presence and fulfill His promises of vindication and justice.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the God of the Covenant/Jesus of Nazareth)
tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
he will destroy evil and pain in all its forms
God did not remain where he was... but came down

object.identificatie: Vindication, Justice, and the overcoming of 'Absence'
tekstueel_bewijs: an absence that has been overcome
his vindication awaits the proper moment
it is an inalienable part of God’s nature that he keeps his promises

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Communal' Body (Victims, the Church, and even the 'Upper Level' sinners)
tekstueel_bewijs: Behold, consider, we are all thy people
to each and all, we bring this announcement
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: What the church holds on to, by grace through faith, is two things: we hold on to memory, and we hold on to hope
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject, but also the source of the Helper (Faith).

tegenstander.identificatie: The Powers of Darkness / Iniquity / The Hiddenness of God
tekstueel_bewijs: delivered us into the hand of our iniquities
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits, but systemic evil (Klan, murder, AIDS) and the ontological silence of God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church/Believer identifying with victims and resisting darkness while waiting.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / Beulah Mae Donald
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (resistance) is a response to the memory of God's past acts and the hope of His future coming.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Nature → Justice/Presence → The Suffering Community

voorbeelden: The community goes on addressing him... insisting that God has got to do something
Faith teaches us that God is to be trusted
Jesus of Nazareth had power to heal
God's hiding of himself is in order to make himself known

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's sovereign ability (Pouvoir) to act even when humans lack the power to see Him or change their circumstances.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved eschatologically: God's absence is an 'absence that has been overcome' in Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described with brutal realism (murder, axes, AIDS).

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it calls for human solidarity, this is framed as a participation in God's own movement toward the world, not a condition for His arrival.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in Beulah Mae Donald
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Her fortitude and determination made it possible to win a decision

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the eschaton
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
delivered us into the hand of our iniquities

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Beulah Mae Donald is used as an example of faith, but her strength is explicitly attributed to God's presence in her faith.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Isaiah (as a model of communal lament)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: God is the one who empowers the lament and the forgiveness.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope amidst suffering; stripping away of self-reliance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic in its final accomplishment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'darkness' of the world to the 'hiddenness' of God to the 'certainty' of His coming is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's protection and the death of the missionaries.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he will destroy evil and pain in all its forms, once and forever

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of faith (Memory/Hope) to endure the 'Time Between'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is an active force ('delivered into the hand of our iniquities') that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's future action (Subject) breaking into a present state of lack (Object: Justice/Presence). Humans are correctly positioned as the 'Communal Receiver'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The move to 'Pouvoir' (God's power) at the end is sufficient.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's coming) clearly grounds the Ethics (Solidarity).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that refuses to blink in the face of evil while keeping God as the primary actor.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Grand Central' metaphor, Greimas shows that the metaphor functions to define the 'Receiver's' location.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 64; Greimas explains how the sermon uses Isaiah 64 to re-orient the hearer's identity from 'Subject of their own life' to 'Receiver of God's advent'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Second-level gallery' is a false 'Sender' of values (self-blessing) that the sermon systematically deconstructs.

appendices.notities: The sermon perfectly illustrates the 'Rutledge Rule' by making God the subject of the final, decisive active verbs.
